perturbation.original_text: Throughout the Term (as defined below), Sponsor shall be the * * * vitamin and supplement sponsor of, and the * * * vitamin and supplement advertiser on, the drkoop.com Website * * *
perturbation.changed_text: Throughout the Duration (as defined below), Sponsor shall be the * * * vitamin and supplement sponsor of, and the * * * vitamin and supplement advertiser on, the drkoop.com Website * * *
perturbation.explanation: The agreement uses 'Term' in Article VIII to define the length of the agreement. Changing the reference to 'Duration' in Section 1.1 creates uncertainty about whether 'Term' and 'Duration' refer to the same period, thereby impacting the sponsor's exclusive rights and the length of the sponsorship agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Drkoop.com shall provide Sponsor with Sponsor usage reports on a monthly basis. Sponsor shall have the right to use such data for its internal business purposes, but may not provide such data for use by third parties. Such reports shall contain substantially the same types of information delivered to other of drkoop.com's similarly situated partners, which reports will include information regarding impressions, clickthroughs and any information known about the users of such areas in aggregate form.
perturbation.changed_text: Drkoop.com shall provide Sponsor with Sponsor usage reports on a monthly basis. Sponsor shall have the right to use such data for its internal business purposes, but may not provide such data for use by external entities. Such reports shall contain substantially the same types of information delivered to other of drkoop.com's similarly situated partners, which reports will include information regarding impressions, clickthroughs and any information known about the users of such areas in aggregate form.
perturbation.explanation: Section 2.3 restricts the use of data to 'internal business purposes' and prohibits providing data to 'third parties'. Modifying 'third parties' to 'external entities' creates confusion, as 'external entities' is broader and could include subsidiaries or affiliates of the Sponsor, leading to disputes about the scope of permitted data usage.

perturbation.changed_text: Each party hereby agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the other party and its subsidiaries and affiliates, and their respective directors, officers, employees, agents, shareholders, partners, members and other owners, against any and all claims, actions, demands, liabilities, detriments, damages, judgments, settlements, costs and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) (any or all of the foregoing hereinafter referred to as "Losses") insofar as such Losses (or actions in respect thereof) arise out of or are based on (i) the breach of any representation or warranty set forth in Articles 4, 5 or 6, (ii) any breach by it of the licenses granted by it hereunder; (iii) the use by it of any trademarks or Content other than in accordance with the terms hereof; * * *. For purposes herein, "Content" shall mean, with respect to each party, the proprietary content delivered by such party to the other party pursuant to this Agreement, including, Sponsor Advertising Content, but only to the extent that such content is not altered by the receiving party, and the proprietary content contained on such party's Site, and shall include only that content created by such party, its employees or other persons contractually bound to such party to create such content.
perturbation.explanation: In section 6.3, the term liabilities, losses, damages, judgements, settlements are used but the addition of the word detriments adds confusion since detriments is not a clearly defined legal term.
